259.content:
This application is for all permit types under the jurisdiction of Yolo County Building Division (Yolo Builds.) It is dynamic. The answer to certain questions determine which questions come next.

When you press submit on the final page, your application will be routed to our system and a permit technician will contact you within 2 business days to give you payment instructions, to ask for clarification of the scope of work, or discuss items that are missing from the submittal.

56.label: Project APN or Detailed Location Information

213.content: A permit cannot be issued without an address, APN, or similar detailed location information.

2.label: Owner's Authorized Agent (including CA licensed architects and engineers)

262.content: The applicant is responsible for the permit application and will be contacted for all permitting activities. The applicant must be the owner of the property, a contractor with a valid CSLB license, or a person with written authorization to act on behalf of the owner or contractor.

1.label: The owner is hiring a licensed contractor.

2.label: The owner employs workers on the project.

98.label: Design Requirements

1.label: Any person. The project is does not require a California-licensed design professional.

3.label: Contractor. The project can be designed by the California licensed contractor who has been contracted to perform the work.

2.label: Architect/Engineer. The project requires a California-licensed design professional for all or portions of the work.

98.description: For additional information and clarification of the design requirements for you project, please go to: www.yolocounty.org/yolobuilds

90.label: Designer's California License Type and Number

265.content: If you pay somebody more than $500 for labor and materials, then you must have worker's compensation insurance. Employing workers without worker's compensation leads to a large financial liability. If the worker is injured you may end up losing your home to pay for their medical bills.

264.label: Who will perform the work covered by this permit? (select all that apply)

270.content: If worker's compensation insurance information is not provided with your application, it will be required before the permit can be issued.

53.label: Project Description
53.description: Describe the scope of work for the project.

271.content: CBC 109.3: The applicant for a permit shall provide an estimated permit value at time of application. Permit valuations shall reflect the total value of work, including materials and labor, for which the permit is being issued, such as electrical, gas, mechanical, plumbing equipment and permanent systems. If, in the opinion of the building official, the valuation is underestimated on the application, the permit shall be denied, unless the applicant can show detailed estimates to meet the approval of the building official. Final building permit valuation shall be set by the building official.

1.label: Only serving one- or two- family residential dwellings.

200.content:
Ag Exempt Agreement

AGRICULTURAL BUILDING is defined as a structure designed and constructed to house farm implements, hay, grain, poultry, livestock or other horticultural products. This structure shall not be a place of human habitation or a place of employment where agricultural products are processed, treated or packaged, nor shall it be a place used by the public. The exemption from a building permit does not waive the building code. The structure will be constructed in accordance with the current edition of the California Building Code for a Group U Agricultural Building, along with any federal, state, or local regulations that apply. Any change to the use or the structure that modifies any of the above answers will be submitted to the building division for ag exempt review. Any change of use without authorization may result in a code violation with fines of up to $1,000 per violation per day plus fees for staff time administering the code violation. The County will seek abatement and full cost recovery in accordance with Yolo County Code Title 1, Chapter 5 Code Enforcement. I hereby agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the County and its agents, officers and employees from any claim, action, or proceeding against the County or its agents, officers, or employees, arising from performance or nonperformance of my obligations under this agreement. The terms of this agreement shall bind and inure to the benefit of the parties and their heirs, legal representatives, transferees, and assigns.

1.label: The structure is not habitable, a place where somebody can live.
The structure is not open to the public, such as customers.

225.label: Ag Exempt Not a Place of Employment

1.label: The structure is not a place of employment. Employs enter less than daily and only for less than an hour.
I declare under penalty of perjury according to the laws of the State of California, that I understand all of the foregoing requirements, and that all information provided by me is true and correct.

228.content:
Ag Exempt Submittal Requirements

The review of structures to verify they qualify as ag exempt requires: A site plan on 11x17 or larger paper, Environmental Health Land Use Review Survey, and Construction and Demolition Debris Recycling Plan.

157.label: Demolition Additional Information
157.description: You can add any additional information here.

158.content:
Demolition Plan Requirements

Demolition site plans shall be drawn on 11 x 17 paper or full size plan sheets. Demolition site plans must clearly indicate which building or structure will be demolished. Demolition plans must state the area, height, and number of stories of the structure. Demolition plans must indicate the location of all utilities. Pool demolition plans must indicate how the pool will be backfilled with compacted fill. Parial demolition plans must clearly indicate which portions of the structure will remain and which will be demolished.

187.label: General Lighting and Receptacles Area
187.description: State the area of the structure covered by this lighting and receptacles permit in square feet.

183.label: Solar System Size (kW-AC)
183.description: Alternating Current Output of the Solar System

186.label: Do you already have approved plans from SolarAPP+?
186.description: If you mark yes, then be sure to upload you inspection checklist on the next application page for File Uploads.

1.label: Drainage across property lines will not exceed that which existed prior to grading.

2.label: Excess or concentrated drainage will be contained on site or directed to an approved drainage facility.

3.label: Erosion of the ground in the area of discharge will be prevented by installation of nonerosive down drains or other devices.

4.label: The faces of cut and fill slopes will be prepared and maintained to control erosion.

5.label: Erosion control will be installed as soon as practical and prior to calling for final inspection.

155.content:
Grading Plan Requirements

Grading plans must show the plan of all Best Management Practices (BMPs) required for the project. Grading plans must includes a statement that, “All grading sites shall be required to follow the Good Housekeeping Practices of Yolo County Improvement Standards Section 11-2 regardless of the project size or number of square feet of soil disturbed.” Grading plans must includes a statement that, “All grading sites shall be required to follow CALGreen requirements for site development.” See CALGreen 4.106 and 5.106, and include project specific requirements on the plan sheets. Grading plans must includes a statement that, “The operator shall submit evidence to the MS4 that all permits directly associated with the grading activity have been obtained prior to commencing the soil disturbing activities authorized by the grading permit.” Grading plans must describes the rationale used for selecting BMPs, including soil loss calculations if necessary. Grading plans must includes a schedule of the required inspections. Grading plans must includes a list of applicable permits directly associated with the grading activity, including, but not limited to the State Water Board’s CGP, State Water Board 401 Water Quality Certification, U.S. Army Corps 404 permit, and California Department of Fish and Game 1600 Agreement.

162.content:
HVAC Requirements

HVAC permits are issued without review. Energy Compliance (Title 24) documents and manufacturer's installation instructions must be on site at the inspection.

165.label: Fuel Gas Length
165.description: This is for simple single-line runs. For a more complicated setup, enter "See calculations"

166.label: Fuel Gas Diameter
166.description: The inside diameter of the fuel gas pipe.

168.content:
Plumbing Plan Requirements

For simple single-line runs, a simple plan view showing the piping location is sufficient. For branching networks an isometric drawing is required.

170.content:
Water Heater Requirements

Water heater permits are issued without review. Energy Comliance (title 24) documents and manufacturer's installation instructions must be on site at the inspection.

212.content:
Pool/Spa Requirements

Pool and spa plans must show two forms of drowning prevention safety features as required by the California Swimming Pool Safety Act. One of those features must be either a pool enclosure (fence) or automatic pool cover in order to meet the requirement of the International Swimming Pool and Spa Code. Exempt CBC 105.2: Exemptions from permit requirements of this code shall not be deemed to grant authorization for any work to be done in any manner in violation of the provisions of this code or any other laws or ordinances of this jurisdiction. Permits shall not be required for the following:
  1. Prefabricated swimming pools accessory to a Group R-3 occupancy that are less than 24 inches (610 mm) deep, are not greater than 5,000 gallons (18 925 L) and are installed entirely above ground.
All Pools All pools are regulated by the California Swimming Pool Safety Act which defines a pool as “Any structure intended for swimming or recreational bathing that contains water over 18 inches deep. “Swimming pool” includes in-ground and aboveground structures and includes, but is not limited to, hot tubs, spas, portable spas and nonportable wading pools.” Private/Residential Pools The California Building Code includes the following definitions: POOL. A constructed or prefabricated artificial basin, chamber or tank intended to be used primarily by bathers, and not for cleaning of the body or for individual therapeutic use. PRIVATE POOL: Any constructed pool, permanent or portable, that is intended for noncommercial use as a swimming pool by not more than three owner families and their guests. Private Pools are regulated by the International Swimming Pool and Spa Code. Public Pools Public Pools are all pools other than a private pool. Public Pools are regulated by California Building Code Chapter 31B Public Pools as adopted by the Department of Public Health. Demolition See “Demolition Permits” for pool demolition.

140.content:
The California Residential Code

This code regulates detached one- and two-family dwellings and townhouses not more than three stories above grade plane in height with a separate means of egress, and their accessory structures not more than three stories above grade plane in height.

222.label: Applicant Notes
222.description: If you have any additional information about your permit or clarifications about any of the answers on this application, you can place that in this section.

123.content:
File Upload

Attach your construction documents using the tool below. Files must be in pdf format with a maximum file size of 50 MB. Flatten/optimize all files to reduce file size. Name all construction documents in a format similar to the examples provided here, using the actual project address: 12345 CR 98 - Plans.pdf 12345 CR 98 - Calcs - Structural.pdf 12345 CR 98 - Calcs - Foundation.pdf 12345 CR 98 - Calcs - Trusses.pdf 12345 CR 98 - Specs - Solar Equipment.pdf Plan Sheets should be in a single pdf unless after flattening and optimization they still exceed the file size limit.

112.label: File Upload
112.description: Upload all of your construction documents here. Files are limited to pdf and 50 MB max. Flatten/optimize all files to reduce file size.
